intro: Lotononis uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces a single flower per stem. Lotononis uniflora is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique type of shrubland ecosystem.
